intro: Chaenorhinum tenellum, commonly known as the slender yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
